comment: "I thought this move was sufficient. At this point I stood up to relief my legs and see how th either games were going. One of the chessplayers told me: - You have your opponent. - I don't know - I replied - it is a very difficult moment.- I went back near my chessboard and Zukertort had not done his move yet. Only then I realized that my opponent had an extraordinary possibility. I hoped that he did not see it. I was not in the doubt for long time. I had gone away again when I heard a loud noise, as if a piece was put with some violence on the chessboard. I did not turn back, and somebody touched my shoulder: - You clock has startd, I have done my move - Zukertort told me. The expression of his face, the way he straightened his back and lengthened his body, made my stomach fall down to the floor." (Blackburne)
reasoning: The comment does not directly explain the mistake made by the player, but rather describes the player's experience and emotions during the game.
